questions.question_text: Which two are characteristics of GETVPN? (Choose two.)

choices.B: A key server is elected among all configured Group Members
choices.D: The same key encryption and traffic encryption keys are distributed to all Group Members
choices.C: Unique encryption keys are computed for each Group Member
choices.A: The IP header of the encrypted packet is preserved

Device# show crypto ikev2 proposal default

IKEv2 proposal: default
Encryption: AES-CBC-256 AES-CBC-192 AES-CBC-128
Integrity: SHA512 SHA384 SHA256 SHA96 MD596
PRF: SHA512 SHA384 SHA256 SHA1 MD5
DH Group: DH_GROUP_1536_MODP/Group 5 DH_GROUP_1024_MODP/Group 2.

questions.question_text: Which transform set is contained in the IKEv2 default proposal?

discussion.content:
The answer to this should be C.

http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/asa-5500-x-series-next-generation-firewalls/70511-sslvpnclient-asa.html#step2

From the document above under link “Step 2. Install and Enable the SSL VPN Client on the ASA”. Starting with Step 5, it said to enable the “SSL VPN Client” after uploading the image.

choices.C: The SSL VPN client must be enabled on the ASA after loading
choices.A: The SSL client must be loaded to the client by an ASA administrator
choices.D: The SSL client must be enabled on the client machine before loading
choices.B: The SSL client must be downloaded to the client via FTP

questions.question_text:
The following configuration steps have been completeD.
✑ WebVPN was enabled on the ASA outside interface.
✑ SSL VPN client software was loaded to the ASA.
✑ A DHCP scope was configured and applied to a WebVPN Tunnel Group.
What additional step is required if the client software fails to load when connecting to the ASA SSL page?

choices.C: It has a keepalive of 60 minutes, checking every 5 minutes.
choices.B: It will use encrypted nonces for authentication.
choices.A: The tunnel will be valid for 2 days, 88 minutes, and 00 seconds.

discussion.content:
The RSA-encrypted nonces method uses the RSA encryption public key cryptography standard. It requires that each party generate a pseudo-random number (a nonce) and encrypt it in the other party's RSA public key. Authentication occurs when each party decrypts the other party's nonce with a local private key (and other publicly and privately available information) and then uses the decrypted nonce to compute a keyed hash. This system provides for deniable transactions. That is, either side of the exchange can plausibly deny that it took part in the exchange.

Cisco IOS software is the only Cisco product that uses RSA-encrypted nonces for IKE authentication. RSA-encrypted nonces use the RSA public key algorithm.

choices.B: when an application is failing in the rewrite process
choices.C: when IPsec should be used over SSL VPN
choices.D: when a user has a nonsupported Java version installed
choices.A: when a user is using an outdated version of a web browser
